channel.title: Error connecting to server
channel.description: I did the Utorrent portforwarding all correct, i did no-ip correct, i did it all, i changed my clients client.java ip's, but is there a way to change a source's ip? Cuz when i hit initialize server.bat it says [3/16/12 10:35 AM] Server Listening on port 0.0.0.0:43594 How do i make it the right ip, the ports right, but ip isnt.

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @br0nz3_pk3r br0nz3 pk3r
item.description:
@br0nz3_pk3r wrote:

Tutorial:

http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-vista/Open-a-port-in-Windows-Firewall

Mine doesnt have Add port, it has allow another program… And it pops up a window saying Path: and all other junk, nothing about a port.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @br0nz3_pk3r br0nz3 pk3r
item.description:
@br0nz3_pk3r wrote:

Tutorial:

Only suggestion I have is to make sure your windows firewall isn’t blocking incoming/outgoing connections. You will most likely need to add in and out exceptions for the port you are using to host it (43594).

I seen that on the tutorial, but idk how to add a PORT, any help at all? I kno u hit add program, then what?

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Only suggestion I have is to make sure your windows firewall isn’t blocking incoming/outgoing connections. You will most likely need to add in and out exceptions for the port you are using to host it (43594).

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @br0nz3_pk3r br0nz3 pk3r
item.description:
@br0nz3_pk3r wrote:

Tutorial:

The only reason you would ever have to change the connection information in the server is if you change the port. By default it is 43594 and 0.0.0.0. You might be thinking, “Why is it 0.0.0.0 and not my no-ip?”. Well, you are hosting the server on your local host, not the no-ip. No-ip has no connection to your local host address, only to your IPv4 address, which is what other routers/modems use to communicate to your computer.

So. Thanks for the info, have any idea how to fix?

Read full topic

The only reason you would ever have to change the connection information in the server is if you change the port. By default it is 43594 and 0.0.0.0. You might be thinking, “Why is it 0.0.0.0 and not my no-ip?”. Well, you are hosting the server on your local host, not the no-ip. No-ip has no connection to your local host address, only to your IPv4 address, which is what other routers/modems use to communicate to your computer.

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @br0nz3_pk3r br0nz3 pk3r
item.description:
@br0nz3_pk3r wrote:

PimpDaddyXD:

In client look for " 127.0.0.1" or look for “no-ip” change that to your no-ip or hamachi. I used hamachi, your hamachi address you replace with what you find for the “no-ip, or 127.0.0.1” then you make a network on it and have people connect, release it and bam! your good for now. I had this problem. Maybe your problem is you didn’t compile your server?. LOL.

i changed both ips, and it still says error connecting to server, team viewer please?

Read full topic
